intro: Appendicula longa, commonly known as the long-tailed appendicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Appendicula longa is noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
